page.title: 01INFORMATION ON BURWELL.
page.content: Our block is mainly{fen-land}drained for{arable farming}by a network of dykes.It contains the N. part of the village on the E. bank of the Lode. Many of{the oldest clunch houses}are end on to{North St}which follows the fen-edge.Their{long gardens}give them {river mooring.}Also on one side of the Lode is a{Camping and Caravaning Park where you can hire boats.On the other side is the{Recreation Ground. There are several shops and small building firms,2 pubs and 2 chapels. There is a large council estate as well as newer private housing. A{new Sports Hall and Community {Primary School}are on the{Village {College}site with the Library and Playgroup. An old{brick-factory and pits}in the fen are now used by a road building firm.A{cold store}is also close by.
